children.text: Level Catalogue

Up, Down, and Through V2!

"Up, Down, and Through" was my first level, dating back to within a couple days of joining the community. You may know it due to its presence in the community pack. The level attempted to make use of a very cool mechanic(see the puzzle wing for a hint) but failed miserably due to the existence of a shortcut. The new version of the level patches the shortcut and forces people to find the mechanic.

Execution difficulty: 3
Puzzle difficulty: 2
Challenge time: 20.000

Level 30!

This level is a pretty faithful imitation of level 30 from Boxel Rebound. I updated it when themes were added.

Execution difficulty: 7

Momentous!

This is a speed cube level loosely inspired by noobus's "Faster Than a Bullet"

Execution difficulty: 3
Challenge time: 10.000

The reason why all of the levels in is pack end in an exclamation point is because I didn't want the file names to be the same as those in Charlieee1's packs. If you have 2 levels of the same name, it's kind of buggy.

One at a time!

This is a decently long level that uses cube and platformer. The concept behind it is to progressively unlock more and more control over your movement. There's one tricky jump that I've received complaints about, (see puzzle wing for a hint) but I really couldn't think of something to replace it with.

Execution difficulty: 8
Puzzle difficulty: 4

Two at a time!

This level is the sequel to "One at a time!" It uses the concept of slowly unlocking more and more control of your movement in the same way. However, this one is with spider rather than platformer. There are more separate puzzle elements to this level than to "One at a time" (see puzzle wing for hints) but they are all easier than the one jump found in that level.

Execution difficulty: 8
Puzzle difficulty: 4

Inclement Weather!

This is a platformer level that turns natural disasters into obstacles. Here is a complete list of the disasters in the order that they appear:
-volcano
-earthquake
-flood
-wildfire
-landslide
-blizzard
-thunderstorm
-tornado

Execution difficulty: 5

Difficulty scales
The levels all have an Execution difficulty. This is how hard the level is to play assuming you know how it is supposed to be played. This scale is from 1-20.
Some levels have a Puzzle difficulty. These levels do not provide you with complete information about how you are supposed to play them. The puzzle difficulty scale measures how hard it is to figure this out. This scale is also 1-20.

Marble Mania!

This is an auto level, meaning it will beat itself for you if you don't bother using the controls. This is my most popular level according to the level vote tally. It is also pretty fun to speedrun.

Execution difficulty: 0
Challenge time: 19.000

Speed Stacker!

This level can be annoying(see the puzzle wing if you're stuck), but I believe it's worth including because it is the first use of the Ember Machine (TM) which I am very proud of. The Ember Machine (TM) forces you to collect unpinned blocks throughout the level to build up to the finish at the end.

Execution difficulty: 9
Puzzle difficulty: 2

Jump to 3000 deco!

This level was my submission to a level jam that was held when the Boxel Community hit 3000 members. The winner of this level jam was "5 years of boxel," which you are likely to have played in the community pack. (see history wing for full story) The level has references to Boxel Rebound and Tiny Tycoon. This level is also part of my standalone puzzle series, so you will find a version without deco later in the pack. You should try playing that if you are stuck, and then if you are still stuck, check the puzzle wing for a hint.

Execution difficulty: 2
Puzzle difficulty: 2
Level Catalogue(unfinished)
Puzzle Wing(coming soon)
History Wing (coming soon)

Trust Fall V2!

This is an incredibly hard level where you have to bring the unpinned cube all the way through the level to finish(you can check the puzzle wing if you're having trouble. The previous version had a cheese that allowed that entire element to be skipped. The cheese is patched now. This level is currently unverified. Will you be the first to beat it?

Execution difficulty: 20
Puzzle difficulty: 9

Loopy

A spider level made to be speedran. This was the first spider level I ever made. As a touchpad user, I'm partial to platformer and cube.

Execution difficulty: 4
Challenge time: 10.000

Rise Up!

This is a level where you spam jump to travel straight up while avoiding the spikes. The original version of this level used the unpinned block to refresh your jump, and you would sometimes lose it. It now uses the power block, so the only function of the above-the-head block is to slow the player down.

Execution difficulty: 2

Shortcut City!

I added a huge amount of intentional shortcuts to this level. The hardest shortcuts should also be the fastest. Following the main route is long and boring. Good luck!

Execution difficulty: 11

Stravick!

This cube level is comprised of 2 block types at 2 sizes and 2 rotations(excluding the finish). Why? I don't know. I just thought it was interesting for some reason.

Execution difficulty: 3

theMostannoying Level!

This level is made to be as annoying as possible. I planned on naming it "My Level" as an extra layer of annoyingness, but Charlieee1 put the brakes on. After witnessing inexperienced level creators making mistake after mistake, I decided to traumatize the mistakes away with this absolute dumpster of a level(check the puzzle wing for hints). Have fun!

Execution difficulty: 13
Puzzle difficulty: 10

Blockage!
This is standalone puzzle #1(check puzzle wing for hints). It's only one day older than "Up, Down, and Through. It uses platformer mode. There is an existing way to cheese it.

Execution difficulty: 1
Puzzle difficulty: 7

Mutated Sled!

This is Standalone Puzzle #2(check puzzle wing for hints). It was created because Charlieee1 asked me to make a puzzle using the new mechanic (resizing of non-players). It used to be named "Poozle." It uses platformer mode. There is a way of cheesing it.

Execution difficulty: 2
Puzzle difficulty: 2

Goal Kick!

This is standalone puzzle #3(check puzzle wing for hints). It uses platformer mode. There is no known way to cheese it. I once achieved a time of 3.813 seconds on this level. No one has been able to recreate it and the consensus is that it was due to a glitch that saves velocity between resets.

Execution difficulty: 3
Puzzle difficulty: 2
Challenge time: 4.000
About Me(coming soon)

Tip the Scale!

This is standalone puzzle #4(check puzzle wing for hints). It uses platformer mode. There is no known cheese.

Execution difficulty: 4
Puzzle difficulty: 5

Bloopers!

This is standalone puzzle #5(check puzzle wing for hints). It uses 2 things that happen unintentionally in previous puzzles, which is where it gets its name. The puzzle uses platformer mode. There is a known cheese.

Execution difficulty: 5
Puzzle difficulty: 4

Match-Up

This is standalone puzzle #6(check puzzle wing for hints). It uses platformer mode. The version included in the pack is new and patches a powerful cheese. So if any cheeses exist, they are not known.

Execution difficulty: 13
Puzzle difficulty: 10
Lobby(unfinished)

Floodgates!

This is standalone puzzle #7(check puzzle wing for hints). It is the first puzzle of mine to use spider mode. There are several unintended solutions, but none outright cheese the level.

Execution difficulty: 5
Puzzle difficulty: 3
Challenge time: 45.000

Limbo!

This is standalone puzzle #8(you will be forced to check the puzzle wing for a hint if you want to beat this). It is an outrageously hard puzzle that's not meant to be beaten without help. It uses very unintuitive glitches in the physics engine. This level is in platformer mode. There is a cheese for one of the stages, but the level remains just as hard even with it.

Execution difficulty: 7
Puzzle difficulty: 20
Challenge time: 60.000

Jump to 3000 no deco!

This is standalone puzzle #9 (check puzzle wing for a hint). More info on this level is in the catalogue entry of "Jump to 3000 deco!" This level uses platformer mode and there is a known cheese.

Execution difficulty: 1
Puzzle difficulty: 1

Glider!

This is standalone puzzle #10 (check puzzle wing for hints). The puzzle uses platformer and spider modes. There is no known cheese.

Execution difficulty: 3
Puzzle difficulty: 5

Snake!

This is standalone puzzle #11. The puzzle uses spider mode. There is a known cheese.

Execution difficulty: 3-10(device dependent)
Puzzle difficulty: 4

Boost!

This is standalone puzzle #12 (check puzzle wing for a hint). The puzzle uses platformer and spider modes. Some of the blocks in this level are negatively scaled in a way that you can not grapple them. There is a cheese, but it is slower than the regular solution.

Execution difficulty: 1
Puzzle difficulty: 3
Challenge time: 6.000

Sewer!

This is a collab level between me and Charlieee1. I made the original version of this level on the day that block colors came out, and that version had very annoying/unfair gameplay. When Charlieee1 added it to his level pack, he decided to update the level with better gameplay.

Execution difficulty: 4
Puzzle difficulty: 1

Creation Roulette!

This level was Fisher's idea. Each level creator had to time themself while building, and not exceed 30 minutes (for more info, see the history wing).

Execution difficulty: 13

Creation Tiles!

This level was a multi-month project that I led. It's separated into tiles with each one being built by a different creator (check history wing for more info). Some tiles-Karbyn, I'm looking at you-are tough to get through due to invisible spikes (check puzzle wing for help)

Execution difficulty: 16
Puzzle difficulty: 10
